yeast.name: Abbey Ale
yeast.flavour: Used in two of six remaining Trappist breweries. Distinctive plum and fruitiness. Good for high gravity beers.
yeast.notes: Belgian Trappist Ale, Spiced Ale, Trippel, Dubbel, Grand Cru

yeast.name: American Ale
yeast.flavour: Soft, smooth, clean finish. Very well balanced. Very versitile -- works well with many ale styles.
yeast.notes: American Pale Ale, Scottish Ale, Porters, Sweet Stout, Barley Wine, Alt

yeast.name: American Ale II
yeast.flavour: Clean, tart, nutty flavor. More fruity than Wyeast American Ale yeast.
yeast.notes: All American Ales, Brown Ales, Barley Wine

yeast.name: American Hefeweizen Ale
yeast.flavour: Produces a much smaller amount of clove and banana flavor than the German Hefeweizen White Labs yeast. Some sulfur, and creates desired cloudy look.

yeast.name: American Lager Yeast
yeast.flavour: Dry and clean with very slight apple fruitiness. Minimal sulfer and diacetyl.
yeast.notes: All American Style Lagers -- both light and dark.

yeast.name: American Lager
yeast.flavour: Bold, with a complex aroma. Good flavor depth characteristics for a wide variety of lager beers.

yeast.name: American Megabrewery
yeast.flavour: Smooth yeast with a slight fruity flavor. Lagers into a smooth, clean tasting beer. Use for light, clean lager styles with unobtrusive yeast character.

yeast.name: American Microbrewery Ale #1
yeast.flavour: Smooth, clean, strong fermenting ale yeast that works well at cold temperature. Clean malt flavor is ideal for cream ales.

yeast.name: American Microbrewery Ale #2
yeast.flavour: Accentuated, rich, creamy malt profile. Generous amounts of diacytl. Use for low gravity beers where malt character is needed or stronger beers for a robust character.

yeast.name: American Microbrewery Lager
yeast.flavour: Strong fermenter. Leaves a clean, full flavored, malty finish. Slightly attenuative. Versatile for most lager styles with a clean full flavor.

yeast.name: American Wheat Ale
yeast.flavour: Dry, Crisp, tart beer in the American Hefeweizen style. Low flocculation aids in producing desired chill haze.

yeast.name: American White Ale
yeast.flavour: Smooth wheat yeast with a round, clean, malt flavor. Low flocculation leaves cloudy Hefe-Weizen finish. Smooth flavor makes a great unfiltered wheat beer.

yeast.name: Australian Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: White Labs entry for Australian Ales. Produces a clean, malty finish with pleasant ester character. Bready character. Can ferment clean at high temperatures.

yeast.name: Bastogne Belgian Ale
yeast.flavour: High gravity Trappist ale yeast. Creates a dry beer with a slightly acidic finish. Cleaner finish and slightly less spicy than WLP500 or WLP530.
yeast.notes: High gravity beers, Belgian ales, Dubbels, Trippels.

yeast.name: Bavarian Lager
yeast.flavour: Use by many German breweries. Produces a full-bodied, rich, malty beer.
yeast.notes: German Bocks, Vienna, Oktoberfest, Hells, Marzens, Dunkel

yeast.name: Bavarian Weizen Yeast
yeast.flavour: Former yeast lab W51 strain. Produces a classic German style wheat beer with moderately high, spicy, phenolic overtones reminiscent of cloves.

yeast.name: Bavarian Wheat
yeast.flavour: Hefeweizen yeast with complex flavor and aroma. Bubble gum, banana flavors with apple/plub ester profile. Malty flavor.

yeast.name: Bavarian Wheat Yeast
yeast.flavour: Blend of top-fermenting ale and wheat yeasts providing a mild ester and phenolic profile.

yeast.name: Bedford British Ale
yeast.flavour: High attenuation. Ferments dry with high flocculation. Distinctive ester profile. Good for most English ale styles.
yeast.notes: English style ales - bitter, pale, porter and brown ale

yeast.name: Belgian Abbey II
yeast.flavour: Dry flavor with slight fruitiness. High alcohol tolerance.
yeast.notes: Belgian Ales, Trappist Ales, Abbey Ales, Grand Cru

yeast.name: Belgian Ale
yeast.flavour: Phenolic and spicy flavors. Complex profile, with less fruitiness than White's Trappist Ale strain.
yeast.notes: Belgian Ales, Saisons, Belgian Reds, Belgian Browns, White beers

yeast.name: Belgian Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Trappist style ale yeast. Complex estery flavor.
yeast.notes: Belgian Ales, Abbey Ales, Trappist Ales

yeast.name: Belgian Ale #1
yeast.flavour: Produces classic Belgian ale flavor. Robust, estery with notes of clove and fruit. Ferments well in high gravity worts.

yeast.name: Belgian Ale #2
yeast.flavour: Flanders style yeast. Strong fermenting yeast attenuates well and produces fruity, malty, estery malt profile. Slow to flocculate.
yeast.notes: Flanders style Belgian Ales, Belgian Brown, Fruit beers

yeast.name: Belgian Ale #3
yeast.flavour: Slightly more refined than CL-300. Produces the classic Trappist ale character with esters of spice and fruit. Mildly phenolic. Strong fermenting yeast.

yeast.name: Belgian Ardennes
yeast.flavour: Phenolics develop at increased temperature. Mild fruitiness and complex spicy flavor.

yeast.name: Belgian Golden Ale
yeast.flavour: Combination of fruitiness and phenolic characters dominate the profile. Some sulfur which will dissapate following fermentation.
yeast.notes: Belgian Ales, Dubbel, Grand Cru, Belgian Holiday Ale

yeast.name: Belgian Lambic Blend
yeast.flavour: Lambic culture of Saccharomyces Cerevisiar and a mixture of yeasts and bacterias. Blend of organisms helps create lactic flavor of Belgian Lambics.

yeast.name: Belgian Saison
yeast.flavour: Classic farmhouse ale yeast. Spicy, complex aromatics including bubble gum. Tart and dry on the palate with mild fruitiness. Finishes crisp and mildly acidic. Ferment at warm temperature. May have vigorous fermentation start.

yeast.name: Belgian Saison I Ale
yeast.flavour: Saison yeast from Wallonia. Earthy, spicy and peppery notes. Slightly sweet.
yeast.notes: Saison Ale, Belgian Ale, Dubbel, Trippel

yeast.name: Belgian Strong Ale
yeast.flavour: Dry, tart, fruity flavor. High alcohol tolerance.
yeast.notes: Belgian Ales, Scottish Strong Ale,Trappist Ales, Dubbels, Trippels

yeast.name: Belgian Style Ale Yeast Blend
yeast.flavour: Blend of two trappist ale yeasts and one Belgian ale yeast. Creates a versatile blend to be used for Trappist and other Belgian style ales.

yeast.name: Belgian Wheat
yeast.flavour: Top fermenting yeast with a soft bread-like character. Leaves a sweet, mildly estery finish. Delicious Belgian character to any beer. Great in Wit style with coriander and bitter orange peel.

yeast.name: Belgian Wheat Yeast
yeast.flavour: Estery lor phenol yeast. Plum and apple aroma with a dry finish.

yeast.name: Belgian Wit Ale
yeast.flavour: Phenolic and tart. The original yeast used to produce Wit in Belgium.

yeast.name: Belgian Wit II
yeast.flavour: Less phenolic than WLP400 (Belgian Wit Ale) but more spicy. Leaves a little more sweetness and flocculation is higher than WLP400.
yeast.notes: Belgian Wit, Spiced Ale, Wheat Ales and Specialty Beers

yeast.name: Belgian Witbier
yeast.flavour: Tart, slightly phenolic character. For Wits and Grand Cru. Tolerates high gravity beers well.

yeast.name: Bohemian Lager
yeast.flavour: Ferments clean and malty, with rich malty flavor for full gravity pilsners.
yeast.notes: Bohemian Pilsners, Pilsners, German Helles, Bocks

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
yeast.flavour: Wild yeast strain isolated from Brussels region of Belgium. Adds classic sweaty horse hair flavor as well as sourness and cherry-pie like flavor. Generally used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae after the primary fermentation has begun. Requires 3-6 mo
yeast.notes: Belgian Lambic, Gueze Lambic, and Sour Browns

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Lambicus
yeast.flavour: Wild yeast strain associated with Belgian breweries. Contributes horsey, old leather flavor complex to Belgian lambics. Slow growing yeast that takes weeks to ferment and months to develop fully.

yeast.name: British Ale
yeast.flavour: This yeast has higher attenuation than the White Labs English Ale yeast strains. Produces a malty flavored beer.
yeast.notes: Excellent for all English style ales including bitters, pale ale, porters and brown ale.

yeast.name: British Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Fruity, tart, dry crisp finish. Very well balanced.
yeast.notes: All British Ales, Pales, Bitters, English Strong Ale

yeast.name: British Ale II
yeast.flavour: Malty, clean, crisp finish. Dry flavor.
yeast.notes: British and Canadian Ales, English Bitters

yeast.name: British Cask Ale
yeast.flavour: A great choice for any cask conditioned British Ale. Produces nice malt profile with a hint of fruit. Finishes dry and slightly tart.

yeast.name: British Draft Ale
yeast.flavour: Full bodied, well rounded ale yeast with a touch of diacytl. Emphasizes malt character. Great for porters and bitters.

yeast.name: British Microbrewery Ale
yeast.flavour: Complex oakey, and fruity ester profile. Slightly under-attenuated finish leaves some residual malt flavor. Suitable for low to medium gravity bitters and ales.

yeast.name: British Pale Ale #1
yeast.flavour: Bold, citrusy character which accentuates mineral and hop flavors. Distinct character of a classic Pale Ale.

yeast.name: British Pale Ale #2
yeast.flavour: Smooth, full bodied, well roundd ale yeast. Mild esters. Strong ferementer suitable for strong or spiced ales. Accentuates caramel and malt flavors.
yeast.notes: British Pale Ale, other British Ales

yeast.name: British Real Ale
yeast.flavour: Great for real pub bitters. Has a complex, woody flavor and musty ester profile that characterizes real ale. Underattenuating to leave mild sweetness to the finish.

yeast.name: Budvar Lager
yeast.flavour: Classic pilsner lager yeast. Malty nose and subtle fruit. Rich malt profile, but dry crisp finish. Hop character accentuated by dry finish.
yeast.notes: Bohemian Pilsner, Classic Pilsners, Dortmunder and Light Lagers

yeast.name: Burton Ale
yeast.flavour: Burton-on-trent yeast produces a complex character. Flavors include apple, pear, and clover honey.
yeast.notes: All English styles including Pale Ale, IPA, Porter, Stout and Bitters.

yeast.name: California Ale
yeast.flavour: Very clean flavor, balance and stability. Accentuates hop flavor Versitile - can be used to make any style ale.
yeast.notes: American Style Ales, Ambers, Pale Ales, Brown Ale, Strong Ale

yeast.name: California Ale V
yeast.flavour: Similar to White Labs California Ale Yeast, but slightly lower attenuation leaves a fuller bodied beer.
yeast.notes: American style Pales, Ambers, Browns, IPAs, American Strong Ale

yeast.name: California Esteem (Gold)
yeast.flavour: Use for California Common Beers (aka Steam Beer). Leaves a slightly estery, well attenuated finish. Quite distinct in flavor. Can also be used for complex porters.
yeast.notes: California Common Beer, American or Robust porters

yeast.name: California Lager
yeast.flavour: Suited for 19th century California style beers. Lagers at high temperature and produces malty, clear beers.

yeast.name: Canadian Ale
yeast.flavour: Clean, strong fermenting, well attenuated ale yeast that leaves a pleasant, fruity, complex finish.
yeast.notes: Light Canadian Ales, Bitish Bitter, Pale Ale, Porters

yeast.name: Champagne Yeast
yeast.flavour: Can tolerate alcohol up to 17%. For Barley Wine or Meads.

yeast.name: Classic British Ale
yeast.flavour: Complex ale with British tones and fruit like esters. Works well in high gravity ales such as scottish heavy as well.

yeast.name: Cooper Ale
yeast.flavour: General purpose dry ale yeast with a very good reputation. Produces significant fruity flavors. No phenolics. Clean, fruity finish.

yeast.name: Cry Havoc
yeast.flavour: Licensed by White Labs from Charlie Papazian, author of "The Complete Joy of Home Brewing". This yeast was used to brew many of his original recipes. Diverse strain can ferment at ale and lager temps.
yeast.notes: All American Style Lagers -- both light and dark.

yeast.name: Czech Budejovice Lager
yeast.flavour: Dry and crisp with low diacetyl production. From Southern Czech Republic.

yeast.name: Czech Pilsner Lager
yeast.flavour: Classic Pilsner strain. Creates a dry but malty finish. Perfect for Pilsners and bocks. Some sulfur produced, but will fade with time.
yeast.notes: Bohemian and American Pilsner, Bocks, Oktoberfest, Marzen

yeast.name: Danish Lager
yeast.flavour: Rich, Dortmund style, with a crisp, dry finish. Soft profile accentuates hop flavor.

yeast.name: Doric Ale
yeast.flavour: Good reputation. Reliable clean finish for a dry yeast.

yeast.name: Dry English Ale
yeast.flavour: Clean, Highly flocculant, and highly attentive yeast. Similar to White labs English Ale yeast, but more attentive. Suitable for high gravity ales.
yeast.notes: Pale Ales, Amber, ESB, Brown Ales, Strong Ales

yeast.name: Dusseldorf Alt Yeast
yeast.flavour: Traditional Alt yeast from Dusseldorf, Germany. Produces clean, slightly sweet alt beers. Does not accentuate hop flavor like WLP029 does.
yeast.notes: Alt biers, Dusseldorf Alts, German Ales

yeast.name: East Coast Ale
yeast.flavour: White labs "Brewer Patriot" strain can be used to reproduce many of the American versions of classic beer styles. Very clean with low esters.
yeast.notes: American Ales, Golden ales, Blonde Ale, Pale Ale and German Alt styles

yeast.name: East European Lager
yeast.flavour: Smooth, rich, creamy character. Emphasizes big malt flavor and clean finish. Full but smooth malt character.

yeast.name: Edinburgh Ale
yeast.flavour: Malty strong ale yeast. Reproduces complex, malty, flavorful schottish ales. Hop character comes through well.
yeast.notes: Strong Scottish style ales, ESB, Irish Reds

yeast.name: Edme Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Quick starting dry yeast with a good reputation. Produces some fruity ester. Highly attentive, so it will likely produce a slightly dry taste.

yeast.name: English Ale
yeast.flavour: Classic ESB strain best for English style milds, bitters, porters and English style stouts. Leaves a clear beer with some residual sweetness.
yeast.notes: English Pale Ale, ESB, India Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Porter, Sweet Stouts and Strong Ales

yeast.name: English Cider Yeast
yeast.flavour: Classic Cider yeast. Ferments dry, but retains apple flavor. Some sulfer produced during fermentation will fade with age.
yeast.notes: Cider, Wine and High Gravity Beer

yeast.name: Essex Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Flavorful British yeast with a drier finish than many ale yeasts. Bready and fruity in character. Well suited for top cropping (collecting). Does not flocculate as much as WLP005 or WLP002.
yeast.notes: British milds, pale ales, bitters, stouts.

yeast.name: European Ale
yeast.flavour: Malty, Northern European ale yeast. Low ester production, low sulfer, gives a clean profile. Low attenuation contributes to malty taste.
yeast.notes: Alt, Kolsch, malty English Ales, Fruit beers

yeast.name: European Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Very malty flavor characteristic of Bavarian/Munich Ales. Complex character.
yeast.notes: European Ales, German Ales, Alts, Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Kolsch

yeast.name: European Lager II
yeast.flavour: Clean, dry flavor profile for aggressively hopped pilsners. Dry finish, mild aroma, slight sulfur production.
yeast.notes: Bohemian Pilsner, American Pilsner, Helles, Dunkel

yeast.name: Forbidden Fruit
yeast.flavour: Phenolic profile with subdued fruitiness. Available seasonally.

yeast.name: GF All American Ale
yeast.flavour: Popular all purpose American ale style now in a Gluten Free strain. Produces beers that are nutty, clean with a slight tart finish. Ferment warmer to accentuate hops and add fruitiness or ferment cold for clean light citrus character.
yeast.notes: American Amber, Brown, IPA, Pale ales and stouts. Blondes and fruit beers.

yeast.name: German Ale
yeast.flavour: Crisp, dry finish with a mild flavor.
yeast.notes: German Ales, Alts, Kolsch, Dry Stout

yeast.name: German Ale II
yeast.flavour: Strong sulfer component will reduce with aging. Clean flavor, but with more ester production than regular German Ale Yeast.
yeast.notes: Kolsch, Alt and German Pale Ales

yeast.name: German Ale/Kolsch
yeast.flavour: Great for light beers. Accentuates hop flavors. Slight sulfer flavor will fade with age and leave a clean, lager like ale.
yeast.notes: Kolsch, Altbiers, Pale Ales, Blonde and Honey Ales

yeast.name: German Bock Lager
yeast.flavour: Produces beer that has balanced malt and hop character. From Southern Bavaria.
yeast.notes: Bocks, Doppelbocks, Oktoberfest, Vienna, Helles, some American Pilsners

yeast.name: German Lager
yeast.flavour: Very malty and clean. One of the world's most popular lager yeasts.
yeast.notes: German Marzen, Pilsner, Lagers, Oktoberfest beers.

yeast.name: German Weiss
yeast.flavour: Milder than German Wheat #1, this strain still produces the desired clove and phenol character, but to a lesser degree. Full, earthy character.
yeast.notes: Weiss, Weizen, other Southern German Wheat styles

yeast.name: German Wheat BT
yeast.flavour: Top fermenting Weizenbier yeast. Intensely spicy, clovey and phenolic. High attenuation.

yeast.name: German Wheat
yeast.flavour: Subtle flavor profile. Sharp, fruity, crisp, sherry like flavor.

yeast.name: Hefeweizen Ale
yeast.flavour: Produces the banana and clove nose traditionally associated with German Wheat beers. Also produces desired cloudy look.
yeast.notes: German style wheat beers. Weiss, Weizen, Hefeweizen

yeast.name: Hefeweizen IV Ale
yeast.flavour: Large clove and phenolic aroma, but with minimal banana flavor. Citrus and apricot notes. Crisp and drinkable, with some sulfur production.

yeast.name: Irish Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Excellent for Irish Stouts. Produces slight hint of diacetyl balanced by a light fruitiness and a slightly dry crispness.
yeast.notes: Irish Ales, Stouts, Porters, Browns, Reds and Pale Ale

yeast.name: Irish Ale
yeast.flavour: Dry diacetyl, fruity flavor characteristic of stouts. Full bodied, dry, clean flavor.
yeast.notes: Irish Dry Stouts, Porter, Scottish Ale, Brown Ale, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine

yeast.name: Irish Dry Stout
yeast.flavour: Top fermenting yeast which leaves a recognizable slightly woody character to Dry Stouts. Vinous almost lactic character that blends well with roast malts. High attenuation.

yeast.name: Klassic Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Traditional English Ale style yeast. Produces ester character, and allows hop flavor through. Leaves a slightly sweet malt character in ales.
yeast.notes: Bitters, milds, porters stouts and scottish ale styles.

yeast.name: Kolsch
yeast.flavour: Produces mild sulfer flavor which smooths with time to a clean attenuated flavor. Mineral and malt characters come through well. Clean, lightly yeasty flavor and aroma in the finish.

yeast.name: Kolsch Yeast
yeast.flavour: Very malty flavor with mix of lager and ale character. Crisp, clean finish.

yeast.name: Lactobacillus Delbrueckii
yeast.flavour: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Produces mild acidity and sourness found in many types of Belgian beers. Always used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae and wild yeasts.
yeast.notes: Belgian gueze, lambic, sour brown ales, and Berliner Weisse.

yeast.name: Lalvin - K1V-1116
yeast.flavour: Used for white grape varieties. Rapid starter with constant and complete fermentation. Capable of surviving difficult conditions such as low nutrient or high SO2 levels. Has low volatile action.
yeast.notes: Souvingnon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Seyval.

yeast.name: Lalvin 71B-1122
yeast.flavour: Rapid starter with constant and complete fermentation. Ability to metabolize high amounts (20-40%) of malic acid. Partial metabolism of malic acid helps soften the wine. May produce significant esters, making it a good choice for concentrates.
yeast.notes: Young wines such as nouveau, blush and sugar white.

yeast.name: Lalvin D-47
yeast.flavour: Recommended for white variety wines such as Chardonnay and Rose as well as Mead. Low foaming, quick fermenting, forming a compact lees at the end of fermentation. Use yeast nutrients if making mead. Saccharomyces Cerevisiae.
yeast.notes: White wines such as Chardonnay and Rose. Also good for mead.

yeast.name: Lalvin EC-1118
yeast.flavour: Low production of foam, volatile acid and H2S. Ferments over a wide temperature range. High alcohol tolerance, compact lees and good flocculation. Relatively neutral flavor and aroma.
yeast.notes: All types of wine and also cider.

yeast.name: Lalvin RC 212 (Bourgovin)
yeast.flavour: RC212 recommended for red variety wines and high gravity beers. Alcohol tolerance in the 12-14% range. Low foaming and moderate speed fermenting. Saccharomyces Cerevisiae.

yeast.name: London
yeast.flavour: Produces a clean, well balanced ale. Medium attenuation preserves some beer complexity.

yeast.name: London Ale
yeast.flavour: Dry, malty ale yeast. Produces a complex, oak flavored ester character. Hop bitterness comes through well.
yeast.notes: Classic British Pale Ales, Bitters and Stouts

yeast.name: London Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Dry finish, bold, rich flavor, some fruit profile and a crisp finish.
yeast.notes: English Ales, Bitters, IPAs, Brown Ale

yeast.name: London Ale III
yeast.flavour: Light, fruity flavor. Balanced flavor with hint of sweetness.

yeast.name: London ESB Ale
yeast.flavour: Malty, balanced flavor. Fruity, rich finish. Excellent for cask conditioned ales and bitters.
yeast.notes: English Bitters, IPA, Brown Ales, Mild Ales

yeast.name: Manchester
yeast.flavour: Old english style ale yeast that produces a complex, woody, full bodied ale at warm temperature. Medium attenuation. Good dry yeast for many english styles.
yeast.notes: Complex, full bodied Porters, Stouts, Ales.

yeast.name: Mexican Lager
yeast.flavour: From Mexico City - produces a clean lager beer with a crisp finish. Good for mexican style beers.
yeast.notes: Mexican style light and dark lagers.

yeast.name: Munich Lager
yeast.flavour: Unique Pilsner strain. Very smooth, well-rounded and full bodied. Benefits from a diacetyl rest.
yeast.notes: Pilsners, Light Lagers, Dortmond/Export, Marzen/Oktoberfest, Dunkel

yeast.name: Munton Fison Ale
yeast.flavour: Quick starting dry yeast. Produces some fuity esters. High attenuation produces clean finish.
yeast.notes: High attenuation yeast good for most ales.

yeast.name: North American Lager
yeast.flavour: American and Canadian lager yeast. Malty finish makes it suitable for Marzens/Oktoberfest as well.
yeast.notes: American Pilsner, California Common, Canadian Lager, Oktoberfest, Marzen

yeast.name: Northern German Lager
yeast.flavour: Clean, crisp, traditional lager character. Strong fermenting and forgiving yeast. Excellent general purpose lager yeast.
yeast.notes: German pilsners, Mexican and Canadian Lagers

yeast.name: Northwest Ale
yeast.flavour: Classic Northwest US ale yeast. Slight fruit flavor, malty ale with good body and balance.
yeast.notes: Oregon Ales, All American Ale styles

yeast.name: Noth-Eastern Micro Ale
yeast.flavour: Malty, bready, yet clean malt character. Leaves hops flavor and aroma intact. Versitile yeast for many American styles.

yeast.name: Nottingham
yeast.flavour: Dry strain is highly flocculant and has high attenuation. Produces relatively few fruity esters for a dry yeast. Can be fermented at low temperature to produce lager-style beers.

yeast.name: Nottingham Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: British style of ale yeast with a very dry finish and high attenuation. Medium to low fruit and fusel alcohol production. Good top fermenting yeast for cropping.
yeast.notes: British ales, pale ales, ambers, porters and stouts.

yeast.name: Nottingham Yeast
yeast.flavour: High flocculation - settles quickly. Very good reputation as a fast starter and quick fermenter. Clean and only slightly fruity. Some nutty flavor in bottled version. Relatively high attenuation.

yeast.name: Octoberfest/Marzen Lager
yeast.flavour: Produces a malty, bock style beer. Does not finish as dry or as fast as White's German Lager yeast. Longer lagering or starter recommended.
yeast.notes: Marzen, Oktoberfest, European Lagers, Bocks, Munich Helles

yeast.name: Old Bavarian Lager
yeast.flavour: Well rounded, malty with a subtle ester complex and citrus flavors. Distinct, flavorful yeast is great for Southern German lager styles.

yeast.name: Old Bavarian Lager
yeast.flavour: Southern Germany/Bavarian lager yeast. Finishes malty with a slight ester profile.
yeast.notes: Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bock and Dark Lagers.

yeast.name: Old German Ale
yeast.flavour: Traditional Alt Bier flavor. Strong fermenter with a smooth, attenuated, mild flavor. Slightly dry, clean, quenching finish.
yeast.notes: Altbier, German ales, some Wheat beers.

yeast.name: Original Pilsner
yeast.flavour: Full bodied lager yeast with sweet, underattenuated finish. Subdued diacetyl character. Big malty palatte. Classic Pilsner finish and style.

yeast.name: Pacific Ale
yeast.flavour: Popular yeast from the Pacific Northwest. Leaves a clear and malty profile. More fruity than WLP002. Suitable for many English and American styles.
yeast.notes: English & American ales including milds, bitters, IPA, porters and English stouts.

yeast.name: Pasteur Champagne
yeast.flavour: High attenuation dry yeast. Good reputation. Good for Meads and other high gravity ales.
yeast.notes: Meads, Barleywines, Imperial Stouts and high gravity ales.

yeast.name: Pediococcus Cerevisiae
yeast.flavour: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Creates a high level of lactic acidity over a long time. Often used with other yeasts, and it may take several months for flavor to fully develop.

yeast.name: Pediococcus Damnosus
yeast.flavour: Slow growing bacteria used in secondary to create lactic acid flavor in Belgian lambics. Produces large amounts of lactic acid and diacytl. Prefers anaerobic conditions.

yeast.name: Pilsen Lager
yeast.flavour: Classic American pilsner strain. Smooth with a malty flavor. Dry and crisp fermentation.
yeast.notes: American Pilsner, Bohemian Pilsner, Light Lagers

yeast.name: Pilsner Lager
yeast.flavour: Classic pilsner strain from Czech Republic. Dry with a malty finish.

yeast.name: Premium Bitter Ale
yeast.flavour: From Staffordshire England. Mild, but complex estery flavor. High attenuation - ferments strong and dry. Suitable for high gravity beers.
yeast.notes: All English ales including bitters, milds, ESB, Porter, Stout and Barley Wine

yeast.name: Red Star Ale
yeast.flavour: Good general purpose dry yeast. Change to a different strain in recent years has improved overall quality.
yeast.notes: High attenuation ales with a dry clean taste.

yeast.name: Ringwood Ale
yeast.flavour: European ale yeast. Highly flocculant with complex, clear, but malty profile. Slightly fruity ester.

yeast.name: Roselare Belgian Blend
yeast.flavour: Culture of Saccharomyces, Brettonomyces and Lactic Acid Bacteria. Complex aromas and flavors. May be used for primary fermentation. Primarily for sour brown and red Belgian styles.
yeast.notes: Belgian sour brown and red beers.

yeast.name: SafAle English Ale
yeast.flavour: Fast starting, fast fermenting yeast. Quick attenuation helps to produce a clean, crisp, clear ale. Can be used in a wide range of ales.

yeast.name: SafAle German Ale
yeast.flavour: Low sedimentation yeast, sometimes used in open fermentation. Good for wheat beers, weizens and light ales.
yeast.notes: High attenuation ales, wheat beers and weizens.

yeast.name: SafBrew Ale
yeast.flavour: General purpose ale yeast, widely used. Very consistent, clean finish. High attenuation and good flavor profile.

yeast.name: SafBrew Specialty Ale
yeast.flavour: Estery, somewhat spicy ale yeast. Solid yeast formation at end of fermentation. Widely used for bottle and cask conditioning.

yeast.name: SafLager German Lager
yeast.flavour: Popular lager yeast strain. Produces wide range of continental lagers and pilsners. Clean finish.
yeast.notes: Wide range of lagers and pilsners.

yeast.name: SafLager West European Lager
yeast.flavour: German lager yeast strain. Performs well at low temperature. High flocculation and attenuation for a clean German finish.

yeast.name: Saison
yeast.flavour: Pleasant yeast blend. Leaves a smooth full character to the malt with mild, but pleasant esters and some apple pie spices.
yeast.notes: French or Belgian Ales and Grand Cru styles.

yeast.name: San Francisco Lager
yeast.flavour: Produces "California Common" style beer.
yeast.notes: California and Premium Lagers, all American Lagers

yeast.name: Scottish Ale
yeast.flavour: High alcohol tolerance.
yeast.notes: Scottish Ale, Scottish Strong Ales, Sweet Stout, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine

yeast.name: Southern German Lager
yeast.flavour: Malty finish and balanced aroma. Strong fermenter, slight sulfur and low diacetyl.
yeast.notes: German Pilsner, Helles, Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bocks

yeast.name: Southwold Ale
yeast.flavour: From Suffolk county. Products complex fruity and citrus flavors. Slight sulfer production, but this will fade with ageing.

yeast.name: Special Ale
yeast.flavour: Highly attentive, clean finish dry yeast.

yeast.name: Steinberg-Geisenheim Wine
yeast.flavour: German origin wine yeast. High fruit/ester production. Moderate fermentation characteristics and cold tolerant.

yeast.name: Super High Gravity Ale
yeast.flavour: Ferments up to 25% alcohol content. Flavor may vary greatly depending on beer alcohol. English like esters at low gravity, but will become more wine-like as alcohol exceeds 16% ABV. Refer to White Labs web page for tips on fermenting high gravity ales.
yeast.notes: Very high gravity beers and barley wine up to 25% alcohol.

yeast.name: Sweet Mead/Wine
yeast.flavour: Lower attenuation than White Labs Champagne Yeast. Leaves some residual sweetness as well as fruity flavor. Alcohol concentration up to 15%.

yeast.name: Thames Valley Ale
yeast.flavour: Clean, complex flavor. Low in fruit, low in esters, rich in flavor. Hops come through well.
yeast.notes: British Bitters, ESB, India Pale Ale, English Strong Ale

yeast.name: Trappist Ale
yeast.flavour: Distinctive fruitiness and plum characteristics. Excellent for high gravity beers.
yeast.notes: Trappist Ale, Dubbel, Trippel, Belgian Ales

yeast.name: Trappist High Gravity
yeast.flavour: Robust top cropping yeast. Phenolic character and alcohol tolerance up to 12%. Rich ester profile and malty flavor.
yeast.notes: Belgian Wit, Trappist Ale, High gravity ales

yeast.name: Urquell Lager
yeast.flavour: Pilsner Urquell yeast with mild fruit/floral aroma. Very dry and clean on palate with full mouth feel. Subtle malt character. Clean and neutral finish.

yeast.name: Weihenstephan Weizen
yeast.flavour: Unique Bavarian wheat yeast that produces the spicy weizen clove and banana flavor. Best when fermented at around 68 deg F.

yeast.name: Whitbread Ale
yeast.flavour: Slightly more fruity and malty than Wyeast's British Ale. Clear and highly flocculant.
yeast.notes: Whitbread Ale, British Ales, Pales, Bitters

yeast.name: Windsor Yeast
yeast.flavour: Clean, well balanced finish. Yeast produces an estery ale with a slighly fresh yeast flavor. Not as quick as the Nottingham. Some bannana aroma.

yeast.name: Wyeast Ale Blend
yeast.flavour: Blend of ale strains designed to provide quick starts, good flavor, balance and flocculation. Balanced finish suitable for most American and British ale styles.

yeast.name: Wyeast Lager Blend
yeast.flavour: Blend of lager strains to produce a complex but clean lager flavor profile. Suitable for many common lager styles.

yeast.name: Zurich Lager
yeast.flavour: Swiss style lager yeast. Sulfer and diacytl production is minimal. May be used for high gravity lagers with proper care.
yeast.notes: Swiss style lager, and high gravity lagers (over 11% ABV)

yeast.name: Abbey IV Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: An authentic Trappist style ale yeast. Use for Belgian ales including abbey ales (dubbels, tripels). Fruit character is medium - between WLP500 (high) and WLP530 (low)
yeast.notes: Trappist Belgian Ales, Dubbels, Tripels and Specialty ales

yeast.name: American Ale Yeast Blend
yeast.flavour: A blend that celebrates WLP001 (California Ale Yeast's) clean, neutral fermentation. This strain is versatile and adds two other yeast strains that are also clean/neutral in flavor to add a bit of complexity - almost a lager like finish. Slight sulfur m

yeast.name: American Farmhouse Blend
yeast.flavour: Inspired by local American brewers crafting semi- traditional Belgian-style ales. This blend creates a complex flavor profile with a moderate level of sourness. It consists of a traditional farmhouse yeast strain and Brettanomyces. Great yeast for farmho

yeast.name: Antwerp Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Clean, almost lager like Belgian ale yeast. Good for Belgian pale and amber ales or with other Belgian yeasts in a blend. Biscuity, ale like aroma present. Hop flavors are accentuated. Slight sulfur during fermentation, and a lager like flavor profile

yeast.name: Assmanshausen Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: German red wine yeast, which results in spicy, fruit aromas. Perfect for Pinot Noir and Zinfandel. Slow to moderate fermenter which is cold tolerant. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

yeast.name: Australian Ale
yeast.flavour: Produces a malty, bready, nutty character with a pleasant honey like finish. This yeast emphasizes malt nuances and is very forgiving in warmer fermentations for those who cannot ferment under controlled conditions.

yeast.name: Avize Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: Champagne isolate used for complexity in whites. Contributes elegance, especially in barrel fermented Chardonnays. Alcohol tolerance to 15%.

yeast.name: Belgian Lager Yeast
yeast.flavour: Clean, crisp European lager yeast with low sulfur production. The strain originates from a very old brewery in West Belgium. Great for European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers.
yeast.notes: European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers

yeast.name: Belgian Saison II Yeast
yeast.flavour: Saison strain with a more fruity ester profile than WLP565 (Belgian Saison I Yeast). Moderately phenolic with a clove-like characteristic in finished beer flavor and aroma. Ferments quickly.

yeast.name: Belgian Sour Mix 1
yeast.flavour: Note: Bacteria to use in secondary only. A unique blend perfect for Belgian style beers. Includes Brettanomyces, Saccharomyces, and the bacterial strains Lactobacillus and Pediococcus.

yeast.name: Belgian Strong Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: From the Ardennes region of Belgium, this classic strain produces moderate esters and spicy phenolic character. Results in a dry but balanced finish. Use for dark or strong abbey ales.
yeast.notes: Belgian dark strongs, Abbey ales and Christmas beers

yeast.name: Belgian Style Saison Ale Yeast Blend
yeast.flavour: This blend melds Belgian style ale and Saison strains. The strains work in harmony to create complex, fruity aromas and flavors. The blend of yeast strains encourages complete fermentation in a timely manner. Phenolic, spicy, earthy, and clove like flavor

yeast.name: Berliner Weisse Blend
yeast.flavour: A blend of a traditional German Weizen yeast and Lactobacillus to create a subtle, tart, drinkable beer. Can take several months to develop tart character. Perfect for traditional Berliner Weisse.

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
yeast.flavour: Medium intensity Brett character. Classic strain used in secondary fermentation for Belgian style beers and lambics. One Trappist brewery uses this strain in secondary fermentation.
yeast.notes: Belgian sour ales and labics (in secondary)

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
yeast.flavour: This strain of wild yeast was isolated from brewery cultures in the Brussels region of Belgium. It produces the classic sweaty horse blanket character and may form a pellicle in bottles or casks. The strain is generally used in conjunction with S. cerevis

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Claussenii
yeast.flavour: Low intensity Brett character. Originally isolated from strong English stock beer, in the early 20th century. The Brett flavors produced are more subtle than WLP650 and WLP653. More aroma than flavor contribution. Fruity, pineapple like aroma.

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Lambicus
yeast.flavour: Use in secondary. High intensity Brett character. Defines the "Brett character": Horsey, smoky and spicy flavors. As the name suggests, this strain is found most often in Lambic style beers, which are spontaneously fermented beers.

yeast.name: Brettanomyces Lambucus
yeast.flavour: This is a wild yeast strain isolated from Belgian lambic beers. It produces a pie cherry-like flavor and sourness with a distinct Brett character. A pellicle may form in bottles or casks. This strain works best in conjunction with other yeast and lactic b

yeast.name: Cabernet Red Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: High temperature tolerance. Moderate fermentation speed. Excellent for full-bodied red wines, ester production complements flavor. WLP760 is also suitable for Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%
yeast.notes: Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc

yeast.name: California Pub Ale
yeast.flavour: For that classic U.S. small brewery flavor. CL-50 produces terrific American red & pale ale styles. While attenuation is normal, this yeast produces a big, soft, well rounded malt flavor that really lets caramel malt flavors shine.

yeast.name: Chardonnay White Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: Dry wine yeast. Slight ester production, low sulfur dioxide production. Enhances varietal character. WLP730 is a good choice for all white and blush wines, including Chablis, Chenin Blanc, Semillon, and Sauvignon Blanc. Fermentation speed is moderate. Al

yeast.name: Cream Ale Yeast Blend
yeast.flavour: A blend of ale and lager yeast strains that work together to create a clean, light American lager style ale. A pleasing estery aroma may be perceived. Hop flavors and bitterness are slightly subdued. Slight sulfer will be produced during fermentation f

yeast.name: Flor Sherry Yeast
yeast.flavour: This yeast develops a film (flor) on the surface of the wine. Creates green almond, granny smith and nougat characteristics found in sherry. Can also be used for Port, Madeira and other sweet styles. For use in secondary fermentation. Slow fermentor. Al

yeast.name: French Red Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: Classic Bordeaux yeast for red wine fermentations. Moderate fermentation characteristics. Tolerates lower fermentation temperatures. Rich, smooth flavor profile. Alcohol Tolerance: 17%

yeast.name: French Saison
yeast.flavour: A very versatile strain that produces Saison or farmhouse style biers as well as other Belgian style beers that are highly aromatic (estery), peppery, spicy and citrusy. This strain enhances the use of spices and aroma hops, and is extremely attenuative b
yeast.notes: French and Belgian Saison or Farmhouse ales

yeast.name: French White Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: Classic yeast for white wine fermentation. Slow to moderate fermenter and foam producer. Gives an enhanced creamy texture. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

yeast.name: Lactobacillus
yeast.flavour: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from a Belgian brewery. This culture produces moderate levels of acidity and is commonly found in many types of beers including gueuze, lambics, sour brown ales and Berliner Weisse. It is always used in conjunction with S.cer

yeast.name: Lactobacillus Bacteria
yeast.flavour: Bacteria for use in secondary. This lactic acid bacteria produces moderate levels of acidity and sour flavors found in lambics, Berliner Weiss, sour brown ale and gueze.
yeast.notes: Lambic, Berliner Weiss, Sour Brown and Gueze (secondary)

yeast.name: Malolactic Bacteria
yeast.flavour: Bacteria for use in secondary. Malolactic fermentation is the conversion of malic acid to lactic acid by bacteria from the lactic acid bacteria family. Lactic acid is less acidic than malic acid, which in turn decreases acidity and helps to soften and/o

yeast.name: Manchester Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Top fermenting strain that is good for top-cropping. Moderately flocculent with a clean, dry finish. Low ester profile for producing a balanced English ale.

yeast.name: Merlot Red Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: Neutral, low fusel alcohol production. Will ferment to dryness, alcohol tolerance to 18%. Vigorous fermenter. WLP740 is well suited for Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon. Alcohol Tolerance: 18%
yeast.notes: Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon

yeast.name: Octoberfest Lager Blend
yeast.flavour: This blend of lager strains is designed to produce a rich, malty, complex and full bodied Octoberfest style beer. It attenuates well while leaving plenty of malt character and mouthfeel. This strain is low in sulfur production.

yeast.name: Pediococcus
yeast.flavour: Lactic acid bacteria used in the production of Belgian style beers where additional acidity is desirable. Often found in gueuze and other Belgian style beer. Acid production will increase with storage time. It may also cause ropiness and produce low level

yeast.name: Sake Yeast
yeast.flavour: For use in rice based fermentations. For sake, use this yeast in conjunction with Koji (to produce fermentable sugar). WLP705 produces full body sake character, and subtle fragrance. Alcohol tolerance to 16%.

yeast.name: Scottish Ale
yeast.flavour: Use for classic Scottish heavys, 90's- or strong ales. This yeast produces a soft, fruity malt profile with a subtle woody, oakey ester profile. A mild, mineral like dryness in the finish makes this a very complex strain.

yeast.name: Suremain Burgundy Wine Yeast
yeast.flavour: Emphasizes fruit aromas in barrel fermentations. High nutrient requirement to avoid volatile acidity production. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%

yeast.name: Swiss Lager
yeast.flavour: A unique strain that has both a clean, crisp lager flavor and a soft, smooth maltiness. Perfect for European Pilsners. Like our CL-660 strain, this is an excellent all purpose Lager yeast for those wanting a fuller, rounder palate.

yeast.name: Yorkshire Square Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: This yeast produces a malty but well balanced profile. Expect toasty flavors with malt driven esters. Highly flocculent and a good choice for many English ales.
yeast.notes: English pale ales, English brown ales and Mild ales

yeast.name: Blanche Ale Yeast
yeast.flavour: Top fermenting strain for Belgian witbier and wheats. Spicy and lightly phenolic.

yeast.name: Diamond Lager
yeast.flavour: Diamond Lager yeast originated in Germany and is used in a number of commercial breweries to produce various lagers.

yeast.name: Lager Yeast
yeast.flavour: A dry lager yeast with high attenuation. Ferments clean and malty.

yeast.name: Munuch
yeast.flavour: Danstar Munich Wheat Beer yeast originated in Bavaria, Germany, the home of many of the worlds great wheat beer breweries.

yeast.name: Safale American
yeast.flavour: American ale yeast that produces well balanced beers with low diacetyl and a very clean, crisp end palate.
yeast.notes: American ale, other clean finish ales

yeast.name: Safbrew Wheat
yeast.flavour: A specialty yeast for wheat beer fermentation. The yeast produces a subtle estery and phenlol flavor typical of wheat beers.

yeast.name: Saflager Lager
yeast.flavour: A famous yeast strain from Weihenstephan Germany used worldwide in brewing. Their most popular strain for lagers.
